pageContext.claim: “One of the things you get out of this, you get major tax cuts, and reform. And if you add what the people are going to save in the middle income brackets, if you add that to what they’re saving with health care, this is like a windfall for the country, for the people.”
pageContext.analysis: Proposals in the Senate's health-care plan at the time of this interview would have benefited higher-income families the most, and lower-income families would have experienced net losses, according to an analysis by the nonpartisan Tax Policy Center.
